titleStmt.title: James McFore et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG8589

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
Commonwealth of Kentucky
Carter County Sct

To the honorable Governer ^of^ the Said Commonwealth of Ky Your petitioner wishes to Show to your honor that their has ben a fine assessed of before Isaac Burton A Justice of the peace ^for Said county on 27 of Nov 1862^ against Andrew J. Morgan & wife by verdict of a Jury for $14 dollars and 50 cents for a riot and breach of the peace tried by the Lower Jury both ^offences^ committed at the Same time and we your petitioners from a long acquaintance with Said Morgan & wife believe them to be loyal and influence persons and therefor we yyour petitioners pray you to remit Said fine

James McFore
John W. Burton
C. H. Jacobs
Sqire Mcglone
William Mcglone Jun
Ambrose Mcglone
Owen Mcglone
William McGlone Sen
Joseph McGlone
Thomas McGlone
S J McGlone
Moses H,, Davis
Wasling Yates --
A. B. Davis
C N Davis
Geore W Yates
T,, H. Bellamy
Wm N Enlet
Daniel Perry
William Gorman
James G. Davis
Ruben Bloomfield
John Bloomfield
James Bloomfield
Josiah W. Stags
John Gelett
Henry J Gelett
Newton Bloomfield
Newton Abell
Alen Yates
William Staford
George Stamper
Sander Dummit
George Dummit
Thomas Dummit
Jno Morgan used up Carter County & they have nothing to live on Much less pay fines -- Therefore the fine in this case remitted 5 Decr 1862

$14 50/100 } Breach & Riot
A J Morgan & Wife
Issd Decr 5 1862
